alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Brewster; Crane; Culberson; Dawson; Ector; Gaines; Howard; Jeff Davis; Loving; Martin; Midland; Pecos; Presidio; Reeves; Upton; Ward; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 4:15PM CST until February 26 at 6:15PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Andrews County in western Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... Presidio County in southwestern Texas... Dawson County in western Texas... Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Northwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Gaines County in western Texas... Western Borden County in western Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Northwestern Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Loving County in western Texas... Northwestern Upton County in western Texas... * Until 615 PM CST. * At 414 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 16 miles east of Big Bend Ranch State Park to 12 miles south of Midland to 7 miles west of Tahoka, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 262. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 157. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Andrews, Lamesa, Pecos, Fort Stockton, Monahans, Seminole, Alpine, Kermit, Presidio, Crane, Seagraves, Van Horn, Marfa, Wink, Kent, Ackerly, Toyah and Fort Davis. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
